programme.desc: (2012) Quirky animated family comedy with the voices of Adam Sandler and Selena Gomez. Count Dracula runs a secluded hotel as a haven for monsters, but his daughter wants to see the world.

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow
programme.desc: (2004) Tense sci-fi thriller starring Jake Gyllenhaal and Dennis Quaid. A scientist sets out to save his son when global warming plunges the world into a sudden climatic catastrophe.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Wedding for Disaster: Homer and Marge discover that they're not officially married when Reverend Lovejoy finds out he wasn't a licensed minister at the time of their ceremony.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Eeny Teeny Maya Moe: Homer takes Maggie to Moe's and accidentally leaves her in the playground outside the bar. Meanwhile, Moe's delighted to get to know a woman online.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brake My Wife, Please: When Homer is banned from driving, Marge gets stressed ferrying everyone around, but Homer enjoys walking everywhere - until Marge crashes into him.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Bart of War: Bart and Milhouse are caught getting up to no good in Ned Flanders' house and are enrolled in separate clubs to keep them off the streets.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Moe Baby Blues: Moe becomes Maggie's babysitter after saving her from a car accident when he was about to end it all. She gives him a reason to live, but Homer isn't happy.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bonfire of the Manatees: Marge meets a handsome marine biologist (guest star Alec Baldwin). Will he woo her? Can Homer win her back?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Girl Who Slept Too Little: Lisa becomes plagued by nightmares when the council move the cemetery next door to the Simpsons' house.

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Rylan, Jamali Maddix, Carol Vorderman, Joe Swash and Tubsey are just some of the celebs watching Love Island, Snowflake Mountain, Fifty Shades of Grey, and lots of other great TV.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: What do the Goggleboxers think of Squid Game: The Challenge, The Couple Next Door, Strictly Come Dancing, The Graham Norton Show, Planet Earth III, and Jingle All the Way?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The Goggleboxers watch Saltburn, Gladiators, First Dates: Be My Valentine, Trigger Point, This Morning, The Repair Shop, Bring the Drama, and BBC News on Joe Biden.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Has 'ladies' man' Terry met his match with bisexual Larisha? And will Canadian Donato's transatlantic charms impress Londoner Kate?

programme.title: Celebrity First Dates
programme.desc: Jess Wright from The Only Way Is Essex, Richard Blackwood, Esther Rantzen and Paralympic silver medal winner Will Bayley visit the restaurant for dates with members of the public. (Ep1/4)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: What do the Goggleboxers think of Squid Game: The Challenge, The Couple Next Door, Strictly Come Dancing, The Graham Norton Show, Planet Earth III, and Jingle All the Way?

programme.title: Made in Chelsea
programme.desc: Brand new series: Livvy goes on a date with Kit, but can Jack move on too? Arman's torn between Tabitha and Yas. Jazz gets some home truths. And mum's the word for Alice and Sam!

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Blackberry's: Gordon visits New Jersey to save floundering soul food restaurant Blackberry's. Owner Shelley doesn't want to hear his advice, but then Gordon finds a dead mouse.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Proton Displacement: Sheldon is jealous when Professor Proton asks Leonard to read his latest publication, so he befriends a TV personality from a rival science show.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Itchy Brain Simulation: Leonard worries that Sheldon will overreact when he confesses that he failed to return a DVD to the rental shop seven years earlier.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Tensions rise in Grace's family, and a vigil is held for the serial killer's victims. Tom and Peri rekindle their romance, a proposal is interrupted and Lucas and Dillon are at loggerheads.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: It's Pastry Week... let's hope for no soggy bottoms! Savoury plaits are on the menu, but who will have the judges tongue-tied? And whose gala pie will be their final goodbye?

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Brand new series: At the commitment ceremony, some relationships blossom like the wedding bouquets. But for others, there's communication calamity and a 'do-I-stay?' dilemma.

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Brand new series: It's the time some couples dread... in-laws week! But one couple's breakthrough proves that in-law intervention isn't always bad. Plus: a new wedding!

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Brand new series: At another new wedding, a high-speed bride and laidback groom say 'I do'... what could go wrong?! And will more in-law intervention help or hinder harmony?

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Brand new series: Instant sparks fly in a passionate ceremony as our final couple get wed. And as the in-laws keep coming, one bride falls short for a frustrated friend.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 2
programme.desc: (2015) Animated family comedy sequel. Mavis (Selena Gomez) and Johnny (Andy Samberg) leave baby Dennis with 'Vampa' Dracula (Adam Sandler), who organises a monster boot camp.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Thanksgiving Decoupling: Howard takes the gang to his mother's house for Thanksgiving to protect himself from his grumpy father-in-law who has also been invited.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Discovery Dissipation: Sheldon feels guilty when he gets attention for his accidental discovery of a new element. Raj stays with Howard and Bernadette for a week.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Cooper Extraction: Sheldon has to go back to Texas when his sister goes into labour. While he's away, the gang gather at the flat to decorate the Christmas tree.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Hesitation Ramification: Penny's big TV acting break hits the cutting-room floor, so Leonard does his best to comfort her, which leads her to ask him a bold question.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Occupation Recalibration: Penny quits her job at the restaurant to pursue her acting career full-time. Bernadette accidentally destroys one of Howard's comics.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Convention Conundrum: After the guys miss out on Comic-Con tickets, Sheldon decides to hold his own comic book convention. The girls take tea at a swanky hotel.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Locomotive Manipulation: Love is in the air when Amy convinces Sheldon to join her for a romantic train trip to Napa Valley to celebrate Valentine's Day.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Table Polarization: Leonard buys a dining table for the flat but Sheldon objects to such a big change inside his home. Meanwhile, Howard gets the chance to return to space.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Milhouse of Sand and Fog: Milhouse is annoyed when his parents get back together. Homer catches chicken pox.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Blazed and Confused: Bart tricks his family into going to a strange desert festival known as Blazing Guy so that he can get revenge on his sadistic new teacher, Mr Lassen.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Covercraft: Homer forms a band with four other dads, but their modest early success is soon overwhelmed by the breakout potential of lead singer Apu.

programme.title: New: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Brand new series: The final newly-weds embark on their honeymoons! Meanwhile, a badly behaved husband receives a warning, and will physical intimacy lead to a deeper connection?

programme.title: New: MAFS UK: It's Official!...
programme.desc: ...With Lucinda Light: Brand new series - Gogglebox's Marcus and Mica chat all-things intruder as three new couples get wed. And new bride April fills us in on becoming Mrs Hotdog.

programme.title: Virgin Island
programme.desc: Halfway through the course, the group are encouraged to get naked. Charlotte drops her confident exterior as Dave has a series of sexual firsts with a surrogate-partner therapist. (Ep4)

programme.title: A Few Good Men
programme.desc: (1992) High-stakes courtroom drama with more than a few good actors, including Jack Nicholson, Demi Moore and Tom Cruise. Can a lackadaisical naval lawyer crack a battle-hardened colonel?

programme.title: Overlord
programme.desc: (2018) World War II horror produced by JJ Abrams, with Jovan Adepo. American soldiers parachute into occupied France, where they're confronted by the horrific results of Nazi experiments.

programme.title: I Am Not a Witch
programme.desc: (2017) Rungano Nyoni's BAFTA Film Award-winning satirical drama. In a rural Zambian village, a quiet, serious-looking girl is accused of witchcraft. In Nyanja/Bemba/Tonga/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: (1957) Drama with Rita Hayworth, Robert Mitchum and Jack Lemmon. Two friends agree to smuggle a mysterious European woman across the border, but she soon has them at each other's throats.

programme.title: The Moonraker
programme.desc: (1958) Romantic thriller. George Baker stars as a heroic Cavalier horseman, beating off the Roundhead foe as he single-handedly smuggles the country's aristocracy to safety in France.

programme.title: Saraband for Dead Lovers
programme.desc: (1948) Historical drama starring Joan Greenwood and Stewart Granger. Princess Dorothea marries the future king of England. But then she meets a Swedish count...

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
programme.desc: (1961) World War II comedy starring Jack Lemmon. A luckless naval lieutenant is duped into commanding a dangerous mission into enemy territory during the Battle of the Bismarck Sea.

programme.title: Dog
programme.desc: (2022) Poignant road-trip comedy with Channing Tatum. A soldier with PTSD must escort a traumatised army canine to a comrade's funeral. Can man and dog save each other's lives?

programme.title: Deja Vu
programme.desc: (2006) Pulsating sci-fi action with Denzel Washington and Val Kilmer. An AFT agent uses new technology to reach back in time, stop a ferry bombing, and save the love of his life. Simple.

programme.title: Man on Fire
programme.desc: (2004) Revenge thriller with Denzel Washington. An ex-CIA agent who's trying to start a new life in Mexico seeks brutal retribution when the girl who he's been hired to guard is kidnapped.

programme.title: Hush
programme.desc: (2008) Thriller with William Ash and Christine Bottomley. A man is drawn into a deadly and gory cat-and-mouse game of survival when his girlfriend is abducted by a mysterious truck driver.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Dragonball Evolution
programme.desc: (2009) Martial arts adventure. Justin Chatwin stars as the leader of a mystical band of warriors who are out to save the world from the ancient demon Lord Piccolo. With James Marsters.

programme.title: Baby's Day Out
programme.desc: (1994) Comedy starring Joe Mantegna, Joe Pantoliano and Brian Haley. Inept criminals kidnap a millionaire's baby. But when the boy escapes, there's mayhem as they try to track him down.

programme.title: The Seeker: The Dark Is Rising
programme.desc: (2007) Supernatural thriller. Alexander Ludwig stars as The Seeker, who has the task of finding six items hidden throughout time, which the scary forces of The Dark are also looking for.

programme.title: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse
programme.desc: (2018) Oscar-winning animated superhero adventure with the voices of Shameik Moore, Kathryn Hahn and Nicolas Cage. Can a gang of Spider-heroes save the universe from reality-bending chaos?

programme.title: Gemini Man
programme.desc: (2019) Will Smith stars in Ang Lee's action-thriller as both an over-the-hill hitman and the young clone of himself sent to take him out. With Clive Owen.
(2023) Sci-fi action adventure starring Adam Driver as a spaceman who crash-lands on a strange planet where giant lizards stalk the darkness... 65 million years ago. Where on Earth is he?

programme.title: The Black Phone
programme.desc: (2021) Horror with Ethan Hawke. Denver 1974 and The Grabber is snatching boys from the street. But he doesn't reckon on two kids with uncanny abilities who refuse to do as they're told.

programme.title: The Lovely Bones
programme.desc: (2009) Saoirse Ronan stars in Peter Jackson's fantasy drama. The spirit of a raped and brutally murdered girl watches over her distraught family as her killer prepares his next attack.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Barnacle Bill
programme.desc: (1957) The final Ealing comedy stars Alec Guinness as the latest in a long and distinguished line of sailors, but there's a problem: he suffers from seasickness. So why not buy a pier?

programme.title: The Borrowers
programme.desc: (1997) Family fantasy comedy-adventure starring Jim Broadbent and Celia Imrie. A family of miniscule people live beneath the floorboards of a regular-sized family's house.

programme.title: Tooth Fairy
programme.desc: (2010) Family fantasy comedy. Dwayne Johnson stars as a tough ice hockey player who is transformed into a real-life fairy as punishment for telling a child that tooth fairies don't exist.

programme.title: Bridge of Spies Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Steven Spielberg and stars Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance talk about making their Cold War espionage drama.

programme.title: Turner & Hooch
programme.desc: (1989) Comedy-thriller starring Tom Hanks. A cop investigates a murder to which there's just one witness: Hooch, a slobbering, beer-drinking French mastiff, who now needs 24/7 protection.

programme.title: Bumblebee
programme.desc: (2018) High-octane sci-fi action adventure starring Hailee Steinfeld. When Charlie drives home a clapped-out VW Beetle, she gets more than she bargained for: a huge robotic alien.

programme.title: Top Gun: Maverick
programme.desc: (2022) Danger-zone action as Tom Cruise returns to the cockpit after 36 years. He's Maverick. He still feels the need for speed. And there's a near-impossible mission to fly. With Jon Hamm.

programme.title: Infinite
programme.desc: (2021) Sci-fi action. Mark Wahlberg discovers that his hallucinations are memories from past lives. There are others like him, but they don't all have good intentions...

programme.desc: (2021) Horror with Ethan Hawke. Denver 1974 and The Grabber is snatching boys from the street. But he doesn't reckon on two kids with uncanny abilities who refuse to do as they're told.

programme.title: The Lovely Bones
programme.desc: (2009) Saoirse Ronan stars in Peter Jackson's fantasy drama. The spirit of a raped and brutally murdered girl watches over her distraught family as her killer prepares his next attack.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Barnacle Bill
programme.desc: (1957) The final Ealing comedy stars Alec Guinness as the latest in a long and distinguished line of sailors, but there's a problem: he suffers from seasickness. So why not buy a pier?

programme.title: The Borrowers
programme.desc: (1997) Family fantasy comedy-adventure starring Jim Broadbent and Celia Imrie. A family of miniscule people live beneath the floorboards of a regular-sized family's house.

programme.title: Tooth Fairy
programme.desc: (2010) Family fantasy comedy. Dwayne Johnson stars as a tough ice hockey player who is transformed into a real-life fairy as punishment for telling a child that tooth fairies don't exist.

programme.title: Bridge of Spies Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Steven Spielberg and stars Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance talk about making their Cold War espionage drama.

programme.title: Turner & Hooch
programme.desc: (1989) Comedy-thriller starring Tom Hanks. A cop investigates a murder to which there's just one witness: Hooch, a slobbering, beer-drinking French mastiff, who now needs 24/7 protection.

programme.title: Bumblebee
programme.desc: (2018) High-octane sci-fi action adventure starring Hailee Steinfeld. When Charlie drives home a clapped-out VW Beetle, she gets more than she bargained for: a huge robotic alien.

programme.title: Top Gun: Maverick
programme.desc: (2022) Danger-zone action as Tom Cruise returns to the cockpit after 36 years. He's Maverick. He still feels the need for speed. And there's a near-impossible mission to fly. With Jon Hamm.
